DataElement.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Measurable Disease Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/not/not applicable indicator regarding whether a person has a malignant neoplastic tumor that can be accurately measured in size as information that can be used to judge response to treatment as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Measurable Disease Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a malignant neoplastic tumor that can be accurately measured in size as information that can be used to judge response to treatment as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Measurable_Disease Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:A tumor that can be accurately measured in size. This information can be used to judge response to treatment.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
A finding indicating that a subject has one or more measurable pathological lesions.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Cohort expansion phase: Does
ReferenceDocuments.description: Cohort expansion phase: Does patient have measurable lesions as defined by RECIST version 1.1 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease by RECIST?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has nonregional lymph node metastases are they measurable by RECIST v1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered to the disease specific expansion cohort, does patient meet the following conditions: patient does not have prior receipt of docetaxel and patient must have measurable disease (except the prostate cancer patients)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have disease which is measurable, at study entry, according to RECIST version 1.1 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have measurable disease per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose Expansion Cohorts: Does patient have at least one measurable lesion outside of the lesion to be biopsied?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: For Cohort B1, does patient have measurable NBL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have advanced RCC with measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: For Cohort B1, does patient have confirmed neuroblastoma and measurable NBL/ganglioneuroblastoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is registered to Dose Level 2 or higher in the escalation cohort or the expansion cohort, does patient have measurable and biopsiable disease (in a lesion that is not being utilized as a target lesion for RECIST assessment)?
